channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Neat pile of garden waste, 22nd September
item.description:
A neat pile of garden cuttings has been left on the verge of Kelsey Lane behind properties on Village Way

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kelsey Lane, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fence as you enter alley, 22nd September
item.description:
The metal fence at the entrance to the alley from swanton Road is not fit for purpose. I just tried to walk my son down there and struggled to get the pram in the gap. If it had been a double buggy we wouldn’t have got down there at all and I don’t think a wheel chair will fit. It’s like fence that has been used is too big for the space. Even walking down there you should be able to tell. Wonder why when it was fitted it wasn’t flagged.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swanton Road, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped garden waste, 22nd September
item.description:
The cuttings from a hedge and shrubs have been dumped on the verge of Kelsey Lane at the junction with Forest Ridge. The cuttings are on the verge opposite the side of the front garden to 2 Forest Ridge with its freshly cut front hedge and shrubs. Photo attached for ease of reference and location. They have been there for over a week so unlikely to be moved by whomever dumped them there

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kelsey Lane, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees from 88 heversham Road back garden need cutting back growing into swanbridge road, 22nd September
item.description:
The trees and bushes in the back garden of 88 heversham Road are growing into the path of swanbridge Road da7 5bs so it’s becoming increasingly difficult to walk down the pavement safely. I believe the property is council owned. The bushes need cutting back
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 90, Heversham Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytip, 22nd September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Farm Road, Mottingham, London

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, no MOT or taxed, 22nd September
item.description:
Blue Toyota abandoned on disabled and residents parking bay for several weeks. Vehicle has no valid MOT or road tax. Vehicle has been registered off the road (SORN) but is clearly parked on public roads. Vehicle needs removing please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodlands Road, Welling, London

item.title: Subsiding manhole, 22nd September
item.description:

item.title: Permanent smell of urine, 22nd September
item.description:
Rough sleepers are using Carlisle’s Place as a urinal. There is a constant smell of urine permeating the road meaning residents cannot open their windows from the smell
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1G, Carlisle Place, Victoria, London

item.title: Fly tipping, 22nd September
item.description:
An abandoned bins has been left here for a long time, and it does not belong to any of the residents. At night, rats are getting inside the bin, which is causing a health and hygiene concern. Could you please arrange for it to be removed as soon as possible!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mottingham Road, Mottingham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Faded road markings, 22nd September
item.description:
The turn right road markings and box area going into to Tesco, Edgington Way need repainting. It's dangerous because traffic coming in the other direction are veering into the middle of the road to go around traffic turning left into Tesco.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Edgington Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bridge out of service, 22nd September
item.description:
Bridge needs repairs as its closure is preventing the use of the Thames Path. In addition, the diversion via Odessa Street is not navigable on footpaths for a wheelchair and so it is unsafe for wheelchair users to travel along this part of the Thames Path.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durand's Wharf, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet
